thread.title: Facts we could not ignore | Opinion - Conservative
thread.title_full: Facts we could not ignore | Opinion - Conservative

author: beforeitsnews.com
title: Facts we could not ignore | Opinion - Conservative
text:
(Before It's News)
Guy Benson at Town Hall provides us with a pdf of a letter written by Trey Gowdy to Elijah Cummings, the ranking minority member on the House Select Committee on Benghazi. Gowdy confronted Cummings for
acting on duties “not to the American public, but to your Democrat colleagues and to the administration, including former Secretary Clinton,” adding that he's disappointed in the Democrat's “complete lack of interest in gathering any facts.”
There are many points Gowdy makes that I wanted to excerpt, but my Blogger equipment was unable to copy and paste from the pdf document. Read the whole document here.
to me, the contrasting behavior of Gowdy and Cummings offers a perfect microcosm revealing the differences between the quality of the people in the Democrat and Republican parties.
Benson concludes,
Gowdy alerts Cummings that the committee “plans on releasing these new emails” next week and plans on questioning Mrs. Clinton about their contents on October 22. Stay tuned.
Read more here.
